result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric T Harker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 4; with 1 day of pretrial incarceration credit

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at $4,210.00 payable to Poblocki Paving Co., due by 18 MONTHS or civil judgment.

Provide DNA specimen on or before June 22nd, 2022 of face additional penalties; pay DNA surcharge. Court waived all non-mandatory and mandatory costs except DNA surcharge due to inability to pay. Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC during the term of probation or civil judgment.
- NO CONTACT with: Poblocki Paving Co.
- Comply with any recommended treatment or counseling determined by the agent.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1; with 1 day of pretrial incarceration credit

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric T Harker

records.addlTxt: Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:  JOHN KREJCI  $390.00

See Order appointing counsel for specific monthly due dates for this pending ATTYF case # 2022CM000429.  Money received from defendant will be held in the AFTES account to be applied towards attorney fees upon receipt of the attorneys Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs Due form.
Signed and Filed:  Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs Due from Milwaukee County.

Defendant Eric T Harker in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, and 8: Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 4:

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.
COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction to run CONCURRENT to count 4 with 1 DAY of pretrial incarceration credit.  
Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS. 

AS TO COUNT 4:

SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.
COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction to run CONCURRENT to count 1 with 1 DAY of pretrial incarceration credit.  
Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS. 


 - Court waived all non-mandatory and mandatory  costs except DNA surcharge due to inability to pay. 
- Provide DNA specimen on or before June 22nd, 2022  or face additional penalties and pay DNA surcharge.
- Pay all Supervision fees as determined by the DOC during the term of probation or Civil Judgment.
- Court ordered restitution set at $4,210.00 payable to Poblocki Paving Co. and due by 18 MONTHS or civil judgment.
- Comply with any recommended treatment or counseling determined by the agent.
- No Contact with: Poblocki Paving Co.
- Appellate Rights given.

Defendant Eric T Harker in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Court orders matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Eric T Harker in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Status of Counsel. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review with new clientl.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be held in person.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Eric T Harker in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  .  
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
 Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney John Krejci to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $100.00  Per Month. Repayment to begin 30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment and provided contact information for the Attorney. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19  for Status of Counsel. This hearing will be held in person.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant contacted the court stating he has no capability to appear by Zoom and request an in person hearing.
Pretrial Conference scheduled 3-29-2022 is rescheduled to March 25, 2022 at 1:30pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/11/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Poblocki Paving Co., 12211 W. Fairview Ave., West Allis, WI AND all employees of Poblocki Paving Co.

Defendant Eric T Harker in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/9/22 @ 2p
